channel.title: New Dubstep Track - Tripstop
channel.description:
[url]https://soundcloud.com/dillosophy/tripstop-1[/url] First dubstep track. called tripstop because I'm trying to tweak the genre to be more "trippy" from influences from glitch and break genres. Also I'm throwing in some subtle timing discrepancies. So, what do you think?
edit: new song: [url]https://soundcloud.com/dillosophy/vases[/url]
edit2: another new song: [url]https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=1wh6HJH-M8k[/url]

item.title: New Dubstep Track - Tripstop
item.dc:creator: E-Nelson
item.description:
brokenfridgehinge:

Let them listen to their shitty wub wubs, at least there are still people around with decent taste in music.

I don’t understand what is shitty about a defining feature of dubstep. I’m not trying to make underground dubstep, I’m trying to make mainstream (mass appeal) dubstep. I’m not asking for reasons why it doesn’t fit into a certain niche, I’m asking for constructive criticism based on the actual musical value of it, not how radical or fringe it is. I’m typing this as I listen to that burial song. And I don’t think that song is shitty by any means, it’s just not what I’m going for. Perhaps we have different definitions of dubstep, or sub-sects thereof.

Also that distance song I enjoyed more, and I really liked the percussion, which is something I struggle with.

edit: also I’m not a fan of skrillex and specifically dislike his take on dubstep, but I do admire his ability to grab a much larger audience than most “good old dubstep” artists.

Imonfire:

Wayyyyy to fast. Slow the fuck down that wobble and it’ll be more chill-ish and actually worth a listen. Also, cut down the singing, it’s just not good

Really? I thought it was kinda slow. I guess it’s all relative, but I can definitely try something even slower in the future–thanks for the tip. Also, yeah I’m working on finding more talented vocalists, and I think I’ve actually got one for my next song.

Read full topic

item.title: New Dubstep Track - Tripstop
item.dc:creator: PumaB
item.description:
brokenfridgehinge:

Ugh, autotune. No thanks. It sounds like a Glitch Mob remix. If you’re trying to make some really low tempo, chilled out dubstep, take a listen to Burial:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=zv1BfpZkuFA&feature=player_embedded

Also, fuck yeah, Distance!

nowdays kids dont know whats good old dubstep, they think its skrillex… fuck that

Read full topic

item.title: New Dubstep Track - Tripstop
item.dc:creator: OldDirtyBastard
item.description:
that’s the idea - as I’ve said - I’m currently into ‘retrosynth’ scene - that’s where creative lot currently sticks to. Modern stuff simply lacks melodic progressions.
EDIT:
some more.
https://soundcloud.com/noir-deco/prey-at-the-disco
https://soundcloud.com/noir-deco/playmaker-ent-nemesis
https://soundcloud.com/lazerhawk/arrival

Some are less, some are more explicitly 80’s synth sound.

item.title: New Dubstep Track - Tripstop
item.dc:creator: OldDirtyBastard
item.description:
Lol Rusko:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=rEuFTBG0Rbg

Guillllllt hahahaha

These tracks really aren’t made to listen to out of computer speakers or headphones, you need to be in a dark nightclub with huge speakers to experience the true sub frequencies.

this will do:
https://www.bose.co.uk/GLOBAL/Images/000000000000043482_pp.jpg

Burial

Dub is nice.

EDIT: But to be honest, I find 2 step and 4 to the floor beats tiresome to listen to as of late - this brought me to this guy:
https://soundcloud.com/com-truise/colorvision-wip
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=VhrAlsQ0RAE
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=USAr9xNz1jM&feature=related
https://soundcloud.com/com-truise/02-yxes
His bass and beat progressions tick all the right boxes for me. And plenty of soul.
I think you shold check it out BFH

and tbh, I’ve been lately more and into melodic ‘retro’ synth scene really - much more rewarding:
https://actrazer.bandcamp.com/track/heatseeker

Read full topic
